content: Yes, Microsoft has made significant commitments to sustainability and it is likely that they will continue to prioritize this in their product development and operations. In January 2020, Microsoft announced a plan to become carbon negative by 2030, meaning they will remove more carbon than they emit. They have also committed to using 100% renewable energy by 2025 and to reducing the amount of waste they generate by 75% by 2030. These are ambitious goals that will require a sustained effort and significant investments, but Microsoft seems committed to making progress on these fronts. Additionally, sustainability is becoming an increasingly important issue for consumers and investors, so there is a business case for Microsoft to remain focused on this.
